meanings.definition: Keep safe or rescue from harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: I will save you from the big, scary dog.
meanings.sent2: She saved the kitten from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The superhero swooped in to save the day.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking saved the situation from disaster.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard's quick action saved the drowning swimmer.

meanings.sent1: We need to save our money for a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: He tries to save water by taking shorter showers.
meanings.sent3: I always save my dessert for last.
meanings.sent4: She managed to save time by taking a shortcut.
meanings.sent5: To save energy, remember to turn off the lights when you leave the room.

meanings.sent1: Everyone was invited to the party save for Tom.
meanings.sent2: All the cookies were eaten save for one.
meanings.sent3: The park was empty save for a squirrel gathering acorns.
meanings.sent4: The room was silent save for the ticking of the clock.
meanings.sent5: The garden was flourishing save for one wilting flower.

meanings.definition: To store up or set aside for future use.
meanings.sent1: She likes to save her allowance to buy toys.
meanings.sent2: He decided to save some snacks for later.
meanings.sent3: I always save a little bit of my lunch for an afternoon snack.
meanings.sent4: They save extra supplies in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent5: To save for college, she started a piggy bank at a young age.
